page.title: 11SHOPPING CENTRES
page.content: Hoddesdon has two new shopping areas built in the late 1960's and early seventies. The earlier of the two is the{Tower {Heights Shopping Precinct}and is characterised by a multi-storey block of private flats. Not many people like the Tower Heights Precinct because it has a poor collection of shops and it is very cold. More people shop in{Fawkon Walk}because of theeasy parking and the variety of shops is very good. Perhaps one of the attractions is the presence of a supermarket called Sainsburys. Tower Heights Precinct was dealt a blow when a fire destroyed a part of the building. This caused some of the large retailers to move away.
